concept.title: Mask Types
concept.shortdesc: You can use the following mask types to mask data:

dlentry.dd: Field Masker processormask typesmask typesField MaskerReplaces values with a fixed-length mask. Use when you want to mask variations in the length of the data.

The following example uses a fixed-length masks to hide passwords:
Original Password 1234 donKey 022367snowfall
Fixed-Length Mask asd302kd0 2v03msO3d L92m1sN3q
Replaces values with a variable-length mask. Use when you want to reveal the lengths of the original data.

The following example uses a variable length mask to hide the same passwords:
Original Password 1234 donKey 022367snowfall
Variable-Length Mask asd3 2v03ms L92m1sN3q0jaOmE67Ws
Replaces values with a mask based on a user-defined pattern.
When you define the pattern for the mask, you can use a hash mark (#) to reveal the character in that location. All other characters are used as constants in the mask.

The following example uses ###-xxx-xxxx as the mask pattern to reveal the area code of a phone number while masking the rest of the number:
Original Phone Number 415-333-3434 301-999-0987 617-567-8888
Custom Mask (###-xxx-xxxx) 415-xxx-xxxx 301-xxx-xxxx 617-xxx-xxxx
To avoid confusing masking characters for real data, use one masking character instead of a mix of masking characters.
